content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────────────────
### Extraction System at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Burner inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with drop position Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)
– Associated wooden chest at Position(x=-3.5, y=26.5) serving as the pickup reference

### Copper Cable Factory at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Dedicated factory burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) (placed at the copper cable factory interface)
– Retrieved factory burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)
– Input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– Assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)

### Belt Depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Crafted wooden chest at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as an isolated belt depot
– Transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) placed adjacent to the depot chest
– Dedicated depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) positioned adjacent to the chest

### Electricity Generator at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Steam engine at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
– Boiler at Position(x=-5.5, y=24.0)
– Offshore pump at Position(x=-7.5, y=25.5)

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────────────────
• When connecting transport belts, avoid targeting entities such as steam engines directly. Always add and use an inserter (or similar input device) as the connection target.
• When placing an entity (for example, a wooden chest), verify that the target position is within the allowed placement range. If the target is too far (as indicated by distance-related errors), move closer before attempting placement.
• Prior to placement actions, ensure that the required items are available in the inventory to prevent “no item in inventory” errors.
• Check variable names and references carefully to avoid NameError issues (for instance, ensuring that a defined target chest variable is used consistently).
